topic: Mission to Mars: how space exploration pushes the human body to its limits

ideas.title: The Bondi Bends
ideas.premise: Astronauts returning from Mars try to order a flat white at a Bondi cafe, but their weakened muscles can only manage 'weak tea'.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposes intense space travel with everyday Bondi life, highlighting physical limitations.

ideas.title: Vegemite on Mars
ideas.premise: A lone astronaut on Mars craves Vegemite, but his taste buds have adapted to the bland space food; it's now overpoweringly salty.
ideas.why_funny: Relatable Australian food preference turned against them in extreme conditions.

ideas.title: G'Day Gravity
ideas.premise: A team of Aussie astronauts practices walking on Mars gravity by wearing comically oversized thongs weighted with rocks.
ideas.why_funny: Silly image of astronauts using iconic Australian footwear for serious training.

ideas.title: The Harbour Bridge Climber on Mars
ideas.premise: An experienced Sydney Harbour Bridge climber is chosen for the Mars mission for their climbing skills, but finds Martian dust too fine.
ideas.why_funny: A specific skill is useless on Mars, creating irony and a visual gag.

ideas.title: Red Dust and Rosellas
ideas.premise: An astronaut hallucinating from isolation on Mars sees a flock of rosellas pecking at the Martian soil, mistaking it for birdseed.
ideas.why_funny: Surreal image of Australian birds in an alien landscape, emphasizing psychological effects.

ranking: The Harbour Bridge Climber on Mars
